Dividend.definition: the part of corporate net earnings distributed usually periodically

1.definition: the part of corporate net earnings distributed usually periodically (as quarterly) to stockholders in the form of cash, additional shares, or property either as a set amount per share or a percentage of par value

constructive dividend.definition: a benefit (as unreasonable compensation or use of corporate property) or transfer of funds from a corporation to a shareholder that is interpreted by a taxing authority as a dividend

cumulative dividend.definition: a dividend distributed to preferred stockholders that is added to and paid with the next payment or future payments if not paid when due

extraordinary dividend.definition: a dividend declared in addition to a regular dividend because of unanticipated profits or a nonrecurring increase of revenue

2.definition: a share of the surplus earnings of a mutual insurance company paid to policyholders either in the form of cash disbursements or through reduction of premiums

3.definition: a payment disbursed to investors from the income of a mutual fund
